page.title: 08 (1770-1874)Ermine Street
page.content: { record Baptisms and Marriages { which had previously been set { down in the Castor registers(as { were the funerals until 1855 when { Upton took up the registrations { of its own funerals) {1841 The tithe was committed for a { rent charge of Â£239. {1851 The chapel was made into the { Parish church of Upton. {1849 The Chapel was recorded as being { owned by Earl Fitzwilliam. {1874 The vicary was recorded as being { valued at Â£240 /year. { { Along our block runs Ermine Street,a {Roman road,known locally as {'forty-foot way'.It crosses Barnack {Parish in a North westerly direction {towards Stamford.It misses even the {outer houses of Upton but runs through { }
